page.title: 16BIRDS IN BOWERCHALKE
page.content: Birds range from Kingfisher at the head of the Ebble to the Jay in the wood & Stonechat on the Downs. The Tawny, Barn & Little Owls can be heard or seen at dusk. Green Woodpeckers are often about; the Spotted one comes to gardens for food in cold winters. Blackbirds are common in gardens, with the Wren, Finches & Tits: a Marsh Tit is seen sometimes. On top of the Downs, the Hen Harrier hunts. Kestrels & Sparrow Hawks get their prey; Treecreepers, Blackcaps, Nuthatch & Yellow Hammers all have their haunts. The Nightjar makes its strange call late on a summer evening. Magpies are increasing. Their are many pheasants; partridge now produce 4 or 5 young. Woodcock & Snipe are rarer. The Nightingale sings in the woods in early summer. Rooks proliferate also Crow & Jackdaw.
